abstract: Brazilian Pres Dilma Rousseff, amid calls for her to step down, says she will reduce her salary by 10 percent, slash size of her cabinet and cut thousands of jobs for political appointees to bolster popular support for austerity measures.
lead_paragraph: Dilma Rousseff is scrambling to reassemble a fragmented coalition as her governing Workers Party reels from a bribery scandal.

headline.main: Brazil’s President Takes Steps on Austerity
headline.print_headline: Brazil Leader Takes Steps on Austerity

snippet: Dilma Rousseff is scrambling to reassemble a fragmented coalition as her governing Workers Party reels from a bribery scandal.
